required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Clinical Outcomes After Cataract Surgery With and Without Capsular Tension Ring

brief_summary.textblock: This study was set up to identify clinical outcomes including a refractive shift or change in IOL calculation accuracy and optical quality after Ophtec® capsular tension ring in the eyes without zonular instability.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after capsular tension ring and intraocular lens implantation (cataract surgery) using capsular tension ring
primary_outcome.description: Visual acuity measurement using refractive error correction

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after capsular tension ring and intraocular lens implantation (cataract surgery) using capsular tension ring
primary_outcome.description: Autokeratometry (KR-7100; Topcon, Tokyo, Japan) and manifested refraction were performed to examine refractive errors

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after capsular tension ring and intraocular lens implantation (cataract surgery) using capsular tension ring
primary_outcome.description: obtained with a Scheimpflug imaging system (Pentacam; OCULUS Optikgeräte GmbH, Wetzlar, Germany)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1month after capsular tension ring and intraocular lens implantation (cataract surgery) using capsular tension ring
primary_outcome.description: measured using the ray-tracing aberrometer (iTrace, Tracey Technologies, Houston, TX, USA) at a pupil size of 5 mm in mesopic conditions, without pharmacologic dilatation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after capsular tension ring and intraocular lens implantation (cataract surgery) using capsular tension ring
secondary_outcome.description: measured at five spatial frequencies (1.5, 3, 6, 12, and 18 Hz) using the Optec 6500 vision testing system

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after capsular tension ring and intraocular lens implantation (cataract surgery) using capsular tension ring
secondary_outcome.description: graded after dilation of pupil over 6 mm, based on slit lamp examination findings

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after capsular tension ring and intraocular lens implantation (cataract surgery) using capsular tension ring
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity measurement using refractive error correction

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after capsular tension ring and intraocular lens implantation (cataract surgery) using capsular tension ring
secondary_outcome.description: Autokeratometry (KR-7100; Topcon, Tokyo, Japan) and manifested refraction were performed to examine refractive errors

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after capsular tension ring and intraocular lens implantation (cataract surgery) using capsular tension ring
secondary_outcome.description: measured using the ray-tracing aberrometer (iTrace, Tracey Technologies, Houston, TX, USA) at a pupil size of 5 mm in mesopic conditions, without pharmacologic dilatation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Capsular tension ring non insertion group
arm_group.description: The patients who had same cataract surgery procedure without CTR insertion
The patients who underwent capsular tension ring insertion just before IOL implantation during cataract surgery

intervention.intervention_name: Insertion of the capsular tension ring
intervention.other_name: a pre-loaded CTR in single use injector was inserted just before IOL implantation during cataract surgery

study_pop.textblock: The patients who were planned to undergo the cataract surgery in Department of Ophthalmology, Yonsei University College of Medicine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. age between 40 and 79 years
2. no history of eye surgery or glaucoma
3. a transparent central cornea
4. pupil dilation at the preoperative examination of at least 6.0 mm
5. absence of biomicroscopic signs of pseudoexfoliation
6. normal fundus examination
Exclusion Criteria:
1. presence of ocular disease that might affect the visual outcome (e.g., color vision disturbance, chronic uveitis)
2. presence of ocular disease that might affect contrast sensitivity function (e.g., glaucoma, maculopathy, high myopia)
